perturbation.original_text: Licensee's Permitted Activity shall be in a manner consistent with Licensor's high standards of and reputation for quality, and in accordance with good trademark practice wherever any of the same are used. Licensee shall not take any action that could reasonably be expected to harm the Brand or the goodwill associated therewith. Licensee shall use with the Brand any applicable trademark notices as may be requested by Licensor or required under applicable laws, regulations, stock exchange and other rules ("Laws") and reputable industry practice.
perturbation.changed_text: Licensee's Permitted Activity should aim to be generally consistent with Licensor's standards of quality. Licensee should endeavor not to take actions that might harm the Brand or its goodwill. Licensee will attempt to use applicable trademark notices if feasible.
perturbation.explanation: The original text uses "shall" to create a clear obligation. The modified text replaces "shall" with "should aim to be," "should endeavor not to," and "will attempt to," making the licensee's obligations less definitive. This weakens the quality control obligations. The phrase "generally consistent" and "if feasible" is also too vague.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Lanham Act - which requires trademark holders to actively police and control the use of their trademarks to avoid genericide or dilution. Weakening the obligation to maintain quality standards and use proper notices undermines this control.

perturbation.original_text: Prior to using the Brand in any manner, Licensee shall submit all proposed uses to Licensor for prior written approval.
perturbation.changed_text: Licensee should, when practical, submit proposed uses of the Brand to Licensor for approval.
perturbation.explanation: Changing "shall submit" to "should, when practical, submit" makes the requirement for prior written approval discretionary rather than mandatory. The phrase "when practical" introduces ambiguity, allowing the Licensee to determine for themselves when submission is necessary, undermining the Licensor's control over brand usage.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Lanham Act - which requires trademark holders to actively police and control the use of their trademarks to avoid genericide or dilution. The alteration significantly impacts the ability of the Licensor to maintain sufficient quality control of its brand, potentially leading to a compromise in its quality or reputation.

perturbation.original_text: Licensee shall, at its sole expense, comply at all times with all applicable Laws and reputable industry practice pertaining to the Licensee Business and Permitted Activity.
perturbation.changed_text: Licensee will, to a reasonable extent, try to comply with applicable Laws and industry practice pertaining to the Licensee Business and Permitted Activity.
perturbation.explanation: Replacing "shall comply at all times" with "will, to a reasonable extent, try to comply" weakens the obligation to comply with applicable laws. The phrase "to a reasonable extent" introduces ambiguity and makes compliance subject to interpretation, rather than a strict requirement. This contradicts the original intent of ensuring full legal compliance.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Various - depending on the specific laws applicable to the Licensee Business and Permitted Activity. The weakened compliance obligation could violate any number of state or federal laws regarding business operations.
